bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 154 (Monday, September 17, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BILIRAKIS:H.R. 6837.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution[Page H8732]

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

summary.text:
Commission on Sustaining Medicare and Social Security Act of 2018

This bill establishes the Commission on Sustaining Medicare and Social Security; the commission must report on specified information relating to Medicare and the Old Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance program, including potential program reforms to prevent fraud.

bill.title: Commission on Sustaining Medicare and Social Security Act of 2018

item.title: Commission on Sustaining Medicare and Social Security Act of 2018
To establish the Commission on Sustaining Medicare and Social Security, and for other purposes.
Commission on Sustaining Medicare and Social Security Act of 2018

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
